poem:
**Coffee with a Younger Ghost**

In the café's hum,  
I meet the ghost of my yesterday,  
her crisp attire a whisper  
of who I once dreamed to be.

Time's gentle nod,  
in this warm cup—  
I assure her things shift,  
like shadows at dusk.  
Questions drift away  
as steam rises,  
and the future waits  
unseen, yet certain.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What would I tell my younger self if I met her for coffee? Mostly that things do get better I met my younger self for coffee. She wore a crisp white Agnès B shirt and patent ballet pumps; I wore H&M elastic waisted trousers and the T-shirt I wore to the gym the day before. She ordered … hang on, hang on. First, isn’t this a time-travel no-no? And if it’s OK, I have questions.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
